cluster_relations.rel_desc: Mummification includes the step of removing the internal organs.
cluster_relations.subject_class_group: Ancient Egyptian Funerary Religion and Culture
cluster_relations.object_class_group: Ancient Egyptian Funerary Religion and Culture

qualifiers.OtherQualifier: ProcessStepOrder: occurs before drying and wrapping

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Mummification includes drying the body with salt as one of its steps.
cluster_relations.subject_class_group: Ancient Egyptian Funerary Religion and Culture
cluster_relations.object_class_group: Ancient Egyptian Funerary Religion and Culture

qualifiers.OtherQualifier: ProcessStepOrder: occurs after organ removal and before wrapping

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Mummification includes wrapping the body in linen bandages.
cluster_relations.subject_class_group: Ancient Egyptian Funerary Religion and Culture
cluster_relations.object_class_group: Ancient Egyptian Funerary Religion and Culture

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that a complex process or ritual includes a specific subprocess, operation, or procedural step as part of its overall execution.
args.justification: All three relations describe the mummification process as a composite procedure that includes particular steps (organ removal, drying with salt, wrapping with linen). The common semantics is a whole process decomposed into constituent steps, so a single canonical predicate 'includes_process_step' fits all instances.
Each relation expresses that a complex ritual/process is composed of specific subordinate steps. This is best modeled as a process decomposition class rather than a generic composition relation.
The relations describe how a larger process is composed of constituent steps, which is a compositional (part–whole) dimension applied to processes.

The common semantics is a whole process decomposed into constituent steps, so a single canonical predicate 'includes_process_step' fits all instances.
Each relation expresses that a complex ritual/process is composed of specific subordinate steps. This is best modeled as a process decomposition class rather than a generic composition relation.
The relations describe how a larger process is composed of constituent steps, which is a compositional (part–whole) dimension applied to processes.
